column4: JD: i'm in sort of the same position you are...i'm frustrated with winblows, but i have to keep it around...  :-(
JS: BUT...i will say this...the wireless works in XP, not in Ubuntu...
what card?
acx111 chipset on linksys w54g pcmcia
that has no linux support?
got the linux box d/l'ing everything...but i can't find the damn kernel source...lol
no...it's the stupid proprietary acx111 chipset
yeah, wifi is the new winmodem *sigh*
too true...but i'll get it working...just have to rebuild the kernel...after i find the damn source code...heh
what do you mean, 'find it' ?
it's not in /usr/src/
dpkg -L <package_name> will list files installed by a package
it's not a package, unfortunately
are you running am ubuntu kernel?
then you should use the equiv. source package, unless you want to build your own kernel
that's the problem...there is no package...it's all a custom build...check out acx100.sf.net
what is a custom build? the module? will it only build against a perticular kernel version?

no...since the drivers for the linksys card are proprietary, people have been reverse-engineering them...so it's a custom thing you have to build into the kernel...no packages are out there for it...afaik
no, but you need the source for your running kernel to build it against
exactly...guess i am going to have to d/l the src...
yeah, use apt-get to install the source for your running kernel
ok...that's something i'm not sure on how to do...
uname -r will give you the version of the running kernel; apt-cache search kernel source will show all the available kernel source packages
